title: How to write unique technical content - Quora

response.answer_text: You can write unique technical content by following the below steps: Collect the requirements for the technical content such as whether it is a product or a serviceAnalyze the target audience for the documentCheck whether you have any existing samples or reference documents, if anyDevelop the content structure by outlining the topics at the first.After outlining the topics, develop the concepts associated with those topics.After developing the concepts, you need to find the tasks for each corresponding concept.Develop the rough draft of the document and check for grammar issues and review it several times whether you are adhering to the requirements such as Styles, Formatting, and Standards.If you develop a unique technical content without structure, it may resemble just like an article. You need to develop technical content by structuring as chunks in terms of topics, concepts, and tasks. Topics usually describes about what is the entire document portrays. Concept describes about what is the specific functionalities or features of the product/service in the document. Task describes about the how-to procedure steps for performing an action by end users. In this way, you can easily develop your unique technical content.

Technical content writing is a way to explain a product or service to the users. It can be also some academic topic. The writing should be easy to understand without the use of too much of technical jargons. If you have to use them then explain in great detail. You should write as if you are explaining something to a child. Writing technical content can be a challenging task particularly if you have just started. You must have a level of knowledge about the subject before you can start writing. But, you can only become better with deliberate practice (Writing). Here, are my 2 cents on the question: 1. 80-20 ratio:  Most of the time new writers jump on their laptops/computers and start punching the keyboard. According to me, 80% of your time should go in the research of the topic. You can't write good content without investing time in research. 2. Create a list of terminology guide:  Learn more about the subject by reading the industry-specific guides. This will help you immensely in understanding the jargons. You will learn from the industry experts, it will improve your writing quality. 3. Understand your readers:  This is one of the most valuable things you can do when writing. Understanding who your readers will be goes a long way in writing quality content. Whether you are writing for businessmen, sportspersons or for school children, you should write accordingly. And, as the old saying goes keep is simple. Image Credit: Google.
